office:text.text:p: Installing and configuring the most popular webserver worldwide. Restrict access to certain areas by either password protecting the area or disallow access based on the origin of the requester. Additionally create a name based virtual host.
Web services and for that matter web servers have become ubiquitous. Not understanding how to configure a web server in this time and day can hurt a system administrators career chances.
The first step is export the filesystems created earlier via NFS. Then mount them either via fstab or the automounter.
All configuration will be performed on vmX1.

text:list-item.text:p: The apache server is not install on the base image with aptitude the required packages can be installed.
The DocumentRoot of Apache is located at /var/www/html the new public site will be hosted under the directory public.
File permission must be set correctly on the directory. Generally 755 is a good default.
Place a file in the public section called public.txt with the content “Hello World”. Ensure the file is world readable.
This connection goes through the previously configured squid proxy. Remember to use the --no-proxy flag if testing directly
Place a file in the internal section called internal.txt with the content “For your eyes only”. Ensure the file is world readable.

Naviagate to the /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/ where the default site configuration is located and edit the file 000-default.conf. The configuration bit below must be put into the section enclosed within the <VirtualHost> configuration directive.
Check the configuration and restart the service.
Place a file in the internal section called private.txt with the content “Top Secret”. Ensure the file is world readable (pun fully intended).

Naviagate to the /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/ where the default site configuration is located and edit the file 000-default.conf. The configuration bit below must be put into the section enclosed within the <VirtualHost> configuration directive.

Installating the apache2-doc package will give you all the documentation from the apache project. Under /usr/share/doc/apache2-doc/manual/en/howto/auth.html a sample is provided for this authentication type.
Create a password file with the user workshop identified by password workshop.
The -c option to htpasswd will create a file if there are subseqent users to be created drop it. The -b option takes passwords on the commandline as the last argument.
Check the configuration and restart the service.
